urlText: Diversions at Camden
content:
Buses are diverting away from part of Macquarie Grove Road due to flooding.
  • Buses heading north are using Camden Valley Way, Kirkham Lane and then return to Macquarie Grove Road.
  • Buses heading south are using Werombi Road, The Old Oaks Road, Burragorang Road, Camden Bypass,  Old Hume Highway to Broughten Street, Murray Street, Argyle Street, Elizabeth Street, Mitchell Street and John Street.
  • A total of five stops are being missed.
  • Services may also be delayed.
  • Passengers should allow extra travel time.
subtitle: Diversions at Camden

Buses heading south are using Werombi Road, The Old Oaks Road, Burragorang Road, Camden Bypass,  Old Hume Highway to Broughten Street, Murray Street, Argyle Street, Elizabeth Street, Mitchell Street and John Street. A total of five stops are being missed. Services may also be delayed. Passengers should allow extra travel time.

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Sunday 30 June, Sunday 7 July and Sunday 14 July
  • Route 333 and 396 buses will be diverting from 1.45pm to 2.45pm due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation protest march.
  • Buses to and from the city will divert around Elizabeth St via College St, Prince Albert Rd, Macquarie St and Bridge St then as normal to Circular Quay. Stops on Elizabeth St will be missed.
  • Allow extra travel time or consider catching trains instead.

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Sunday 30 June, Sunday 7 July and Sunday 14 July
  • Route 320 buses will be diverting from 1.45pm to 3pm due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation protest march.
  • Services will be split into two routes between Central and Green Square, and between Wynyard and Gore Hill.
  • Services to the city from Zetland will end trips at Rawson Place, Central, outbound services from the city to Zetland will start trips from Eddy Ave at Central.
  • Services to the city from Gore Hill will end trips at Wynyard York St, outbound services from the city to Gore Hill will pick up York St at Wynyard as well.
  • Check signs at stops and allow extra time.

urlText: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route
content:
From Sunday 24 September, route M92 Parramatta to Sutherland will be split into two new routes:
  • 920 Parramatta-Bankstown
  • 960 Bankstown-Sutherland
Passengers travelling the full length of the route (Parramatta to Sutherland), will need to change buses at Bankstown.
  • 920 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand E
  • 960 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand B
All other stops remain the same.
 
For more information see the news story.
 
This change will improve journey time and reliability for passengers and will allow drivers to complete other routes impacted by driver shortages.
 
Plan your trip with Trip Planner or transport apps before you travel.
subtitle: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route

urlText: Buses replace trains between Bomaderry and Wollongong
content:
Sunday 30 June
  • From 2.30am to 9.50am, buses replace trains between Bomaderry and Wollongong.
  • You may need to change buses to continue your journey.
  • Trains run between Port Kembla, Wollongong and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.
  • The 02:39 Kiama to Bondi Junction service will run up to 14 minutes earlier than the normal timetable from Kiama to Coniston, then run to the normal timetable from Wollongong to Bondi Junction.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
61SC  Bomaderry, then all stations to Kiama, then express to Wollongong and return

urlText: Buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction
content:
Monday 1, Wednesday 3 and Thursday 4 July 
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Waterfall or Cronulla and North Sydney.
  • Change at:
    • Central for buses stopping Kings Cross, Edgecliff and Bondi Junction, or
    • Town Hall for express buses to Bondi Junction
  • Trackwork buses do not leave from Martin Place Station. Local buses are available from nearby bus stops or you can catch the light rail to Town Hall or Central and walk.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
20T4 Bondi Junction, Edgecliff, Kings Cross, then Central and return (bypassing Martin Place)
23T4 Bondi Junction, then Town Hall and return
324/325 City, Walsh Bay to Watsons Bay via Town Hall (Park St), Kings Cross, Edgecliff stations and return
333 City to Bondi Beach via Martin Place and Bondi Junction stations and return

urlText: Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern. Buses replace some trains
content:
Monday 8 to Thursday 11 July
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, trains run between Leppington and Central, platforms 1-12 via Granville, and will not stop at Ashfield.
  • Inner West trains run between Homebush and North Sydney, some to a changed timetable, due to City Circle trackwork.
  • Some T1 Western and T9 Northern Line trains make an extra stop at Ashfield.

  • Wednesday from 11pm to 1.30am, buses replace Inner West trains between Strathfield and Ashfield.
  • Trains run between Ashfield and North Sydney, some to a changed timetable.
  • Leppington trains continue to run but will not stop at Ashfield.
  • Most T1 Western Line trains make extra stops at Homebush and Burwood.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus route
Wednesday night only
43T2 Strathfield, then all stations to Ashfield and return

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Sunday 30 June, Sunday 7 July and Sunday 14 July
  • Route 389 buses will be diverting from 1.45pm to 3pm due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation protest march.
  • Services to the city will be diverting via Harris St, Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Western Distributor, Bathurst St, Elizabeth St, Park St, continue William St.
  • Services leaving the city will be diverting via College St, Wentworth Ave, Goulburn St, Elizabeth, Liverpool St, Kent St, Druitt St, Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Harris St then continue as normal.
  • Stops on Park St will be missed. Check signs at stops and allow extra time.
subtitle: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation

Please plan your trip or use trip planning apps each day before making your journey to get the latest information.

content:

  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction.
  • Trains run between South Coast Line stations and the City Circle.
  • Change at:
    • Central for buses to Kings Cross and Edgecliff, or

    The alternative stop for 415, 461X, 461N and 530 services will be Burwood Rd at Esher Lane (213431).
  • Parramatta Rd after Burwood Rd (213722) will be closed.
    The alternative stop for 415, 416X, 461N and 530 services will be Burwood Rd before Parramatta Rd (213462).

  • Parramatta Rd before Burwood Rd (213412) will be closed.
    Customers for the N70, N71, N80 and N81 services should use the new stop on Parramatta Rd, after Burwood Rd (213460).

    Customers for the N70, N71, N80 and N81 towards City Town Hall should use the alternate stop on Parramatta Rd opp Neichs Pde (213721).

urlText: Diversion in Belrose
content:
Buses are diverting away from Pringle Avenue due to fallen powerlines at Hews Parade.
  • Route 141, 271 and 283 buses to Austlink or Chatswood are using Haigh Avenue, Elm Avenue, Ralston Avenue and Cotentin Road instead. 
  • Route 141 and 271 buses to the city and Manly are using Cotentin Road, Ralston Avenue, Elm Avenue and Haigh Avenue instead.
  • 10 stops are being missed.
  • Double decker buses are using Forest Way instead, missing up to 17 stops.

  • T1 North Shore & Western, T2 Inner West and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall and Wynyard.

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Sunday 30 June, Sunday 7 July and Sunday 14 July
  • Route 441, 442, 437, 502 and 504 buses will be diverting from 1.45pm to 3pm due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation protest march.
  • Services to the city will be diverting via Bathurst St, Elizabeth St, Park St, College St and St Mary’s Rd (Route 441 will continue to Art Gallery).
  • Services leaving the city will start from St Mary’s Rd travelling via College St, Wentworth Ave, Goulburn St, Elizabeth, Liverpool St, Kent St, Druitt St then as normal.
  • Check signs at stops and allow extra time.

urlText: L1 Dulwich Hill Line full and partial closures due to maintenance
content:
From Saturday 6 to Saturday 13 July, L1 Dulwich Hill Line light rail services will be impacted by closures due to major trackwork and maintenance work. This includes improvement work along the track around Central Station.
 
Saturday 6 and Sunday 7 July
  • L1 light rail services will not run.
  • Use alternative transport including L1 replacement bus services, regular bus services or walking, if able to, between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill, or train services between Central Station, Lewisham Station and Dulwich Hill Station.
Monday 8 to Saturday 13 July
  • L1 light rail services will resume between Convention and Dulwich Hill. Due to ongoing industrial action, L1 light rail services will be running at a reduced frequency daily. See the News Story for more information
  • Use alternative transport including L1 replacement bus services and regular bus services between Central Grand Concourse and The Star via Convention, regular bus services or walking, if able to.
L1 replacement bus services:
Replacement bus services will run from 5am to 1am daily as follows. These times may vary depending on road traffic.

Replacement buses will not stop at the following locations:
  • Capitol Square (towards Central and Dulwich Hill / The Star) - Please use the alternative stop at Central Grand Concourse or walk to Central Station (approx. 7 minute walk),
  • Exhibition Centre (towards Dulwich Hill / The Star) - Please use the alternative stop at Convention (approx. 7 minute walk),
  • Pyrmont Bay (towards Central and Dulwich Hill / The Star) - Please use the alternative stop at The Star (approx. 5 minute walk).
See the news story for more detailed information.

Allow extra travel time, and plan ahead using the Trip Planner to see if your travel is affected, or to find alternative transport options.
subtitle: L1 Dulwich Hill Line full and partial closures due to maintenance

properties.smsText: L1 Dulwich Hill Line full and partial closures due to maintenance

Saturday 6 and Sunday 7 July:
L1 light rail services will not run.
Monday 8 to Saturday 13 July:
L1 light rail services will resume between Convention and Dulwich Hill as per normal frequency.
Use alternative transport including L1 replacement bus services and regular bus services between Central Grand Concourse and The Star via Convention, regular bus services or walk.

urlText: L2 and L3 light rail services may be temporarily held at stops or partially closed due to a Police Operation
content:
Sunday 30 June, Sunday 7 July and Sunday 14 July
 
On Sunday, L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services may be impacted between 2.15pm and 2.45pm approximately due to road closures around Town Hall for a planned Police Operation protest march:
  • L2 and L3 services may be temporarily held at stops, or
  • L2 and L3 services may be temporarily partially closed between Town Hall or Central Chalmers Street, and Randwick and Juniors Kingsford.
Impact to services and timings may change at the direction of NSW Police.
 
Please check information screens at stops, listen to announcements and follow the direction of staff or Police on site, as necessary.
 
Due to planned industrial action, L1 and L2/L3 light rail services are running at a reduced frequency. See the news story for more information. 
 
Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner for alternative transport options, including trains, buses or walking.

urlText: Greenwich Point Wharf closed
content:
Monday 22 April until late 2024
 
Greenwich Point Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:
  • Use the existing 265 bus route which travels from Lane Cove to North Sydney via Greenwich, connecting with St Leonards and North Sydney train stations.
  • Additional bus services for the 265 route will be provided between Greenwich Point Wharf and Crows Nest, via St Leonards during weekdays and nights and over the weekends to offset the missing ferry services.
  • Captain Cook Cruises operates a commuter ferry service during peak travel times from Greenwich Wharf Bay Street. Please check their website for more information.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements and check information displays for service updates.
  • For more information on the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade please visit the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade page.
subtitle: Greenwich Point Wharf closed

properties.smsText: Greenwich Point Wharf closed
properties.speechText:
From 22 April until late 2024, Greenwich Point Wharf will close temporarily for upgrades.
Ferries will not stop at Greenwich Point Wharf during the closure.
Use bus route 265 to St Leonards and North Sydney Train stations from Lower Serpentine Road.

urlText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
content:
Monday 3 June until late 2024

South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

  • Public transport options include F2 and F6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • Use the existing 111 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • The 230 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.
subtitle: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades

properties.smsText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
properties.speechText:
From Monday 3rd June until late 2024, South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

Public transport options include F 2 and F 6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
Use the existing 1 1 1 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
The 2 3 0 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Liverpool and Villawood
content:
Tuesday 25 to Thursday 27 June
  • Nightly from 10pm to 1.30am, buses replace trains between Liverpool and Villawood.
  • Trains run between Villawood and the City, some to a changed timetable.
  • Buses also replace T2 Leppington Line trains between Leppington and Fairfield.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus route
3T3 Liverpool, then all stations to Villawood and return

urlText: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation
content:
Sunday 30 June, Sunday 7 July and Sunday 14 July
  • Route 120 buses will be diverting from 1.45pm to 3pm due to road closures in place for a planned Police Operation protest march.
  • Buses to the city will end trips at Wynyard Park, York St and start trips from Clarence St, Wynyard.
  • The following stops will be missed:
    • QVB, York St, Stand E (2000136)
    • QVB, York St, Stand D (200044)
    • Clarence St at Council Pl (2000139)
  • Allow extra travel time or consider catching trains instead.
subtitle: Sydney CBD diversions due to Police Operation

urlText: City Circle: Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay
content:
Monday 8 to Thursday 11 July
  • Nightly from 10pm to 1.30am, trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay.
  • T1 North Shore & Western, T2 Inner West and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall and Wynyard.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall, Martin Place and Kings Cross.
  • The light rail runs between Central and Circular Quay.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or walk
    • Museum or St James, change at Central or Town Hall for local buses or walk
  • Other lines are also affected by this work. Please check details before you travel.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
subtitle: City Circle: Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay
